intro: Paederia ntiti, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, white flowers that bloom at night. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible but often have a bitter taste. Paederia ntiti thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique nocturnal blooming habit and medicinal properties make it an interesting subject in botanical studies.
